devdoc.details: The UsernameController contract handles the registration, renewal, and management of usernames. It interacts with the Oracle contract to determine the price of registering a username and the UsernameNFT contract to mint and manage the NFTs representing the registered usernames.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params.duration: uint96 - The duration for which the username will be registered
params.name: string memory - The desired username.

returns._0: uint - The token ID of the minted NFT.

params.duration: The additional duration for which the username will be registered
params.tokenId: The token ID of the NFT representing the username.

returns._0: uint The token ID of the updated NFT.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setOracle(address).details: This function can only be called by the contract owner.

params._oracle: The address of the Oracle instance to be set.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: UsernameController

register(string,uint96).notice: Registers a new username and mints an NFT if the name is available.

renew(uint256,uint96).notice: Renews the registration of a username by updating its expiry.

setOracle(address).notice: Sets the Oracle instance to be used by the contract.

withdraw().notice: Withdraws the accumulated Ether balance from the contract to the contract owner's address
